title: IIM Faculty and Students Urge Modi to Condemn Rising Intolerance in India
content:
A group of students and faculty members from prestigious Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) have penned an open letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, expressing deep concern over the escalating intolerance in India.  

The letter, signed by 183 individuals including 13 faculty members from IIM-Ahmedabad and IIM-Bengaluru, urges Modi to take a stand against the growing hate speech and violence targeting minority communities. They argue that his silence emboldens those promoting intolerance and threatens the unity and integrity of the nation.

The letter cites numerous incidents of intolerance, including provocative speeches calling for violence against Muslims, disruptions of Christmas celebrations, and attacks on Christians. They highlight a growing sense of fear, with places of worship vandalized and calls for violence against minority communities. 

The signatories implore the Prime Minister to “stand firm against forces” seeking to divide the country and call for a return to a society that values inclusivity and diversity.
author: Scroll Staff
